Beef Curry

Simone's favorite beef curry recipe. 
2 lb. chuck steak                            1 tbs. lemongrass
½ tsp. chopped galangal                6 cloves garlic
2 tsp. ground black pepper            1 large chopped onion
2 tsp. cumin                                    1 tsp. blachan
2 tsp salt                                         8 oz. Coconut milk
2 tbs. ground coriander                  3 c water
½ tsp. chili powder


Place all of the spices in a mortar with the lemon grass, garlic, onion and blachan.  Pound to a paste and set aside.  Put two thirds of the coconut milk into a pan, add the water and bring to a boil.  Whipe and trim meat, cut into cubes, add to the coconut milk.  Cover and simmer for 1 hour.*  

Heat the remaining coconut milk in a wok and add the spice paste and dry fry gently for 5 minutes.  Drain the neat, reserving the liquid, add the meat to the pan and fry over a high heat for 5 minutes.  Add the save liquid and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until the meat is tender.


*If you're in a hurry, instead of cooking the meat by simmering it, you can also just pan fry the meat first.
